fAdTHF"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/cryptography/MessageHashUtils.sol":{"keccak256":"0xba333517a3add42cd35fe877656fc3dfcc9de53baa4f3aabbd6d12a92e4ea435","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://2ceacff44c0fdc81e48e0e0b1db87a2076d3c1fb497341de077bf1da9f6b406c","dweb:/ipfs/QmRUo1muMRAewxrKQ7TkXUtknyRoR57AyEkoPpiuZQ8FzX"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/math/Math.sol":{"keccak256":"0x005ec64c6313f0555d59e278f9a7a5ab2db5bdc72a027f255a37c327af1ec02d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://4ece9f0b9c8daca08c76b6b5405a6446b6f73b3a15fab7ff56e296cbd4a2c875","dweb:/ipfs/QmQyRpyPRL5SQuAgj6SHmbir3foX65FJjbVTTQrA2EFg6L"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/math/SignedMath.sol":{"keccak256":"0x5f7e4076e175393767754387c962926577f1660dd9b810187b9002407656be72","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://7d533a1c97cd43a57cd9c465f7ee8dd0e39ae93a8fb8ff8e5303a356b081cdcc","dweb:/ipfs/QmVBEei6aTnvYNZp2CHYVNKyZS4q1KkjANfY39WVXZXVoT"]},"src/ethereum/EnhancedAccount.sol":{"keccak256":"0xfa73d80e35a4749c241871e79cc036c6f5ad92386c59f528673f5e095bcabbb3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://d1d6739d0ce3e2b24a24c76e755814a07334b0b26ecb18f6cf6da6a7f9483741","dweb:/ipfs/QmPSQE6hwo3SuMJhKbem4kmU7j8zhDUxkdRsQjoV5JTYKw"]}},"version":1}

params.amount: The amount of tokens to approve.

executeBatchWithTransient(address[],uint.details: Uses local variables to simulate transient storage.

params.data: List of calldata for each destination.
params.values: List of ETH amounts to send.

params.otp: A one-time password for additional security.
params.secondarySignature: Signature from the secondary key for the OTP.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.limit: The new daily limit in wei.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.guardianSignatures: The signatures of the guardians approving the recovery.
params.newOwner: The address to transfer ownership to.

validateUserOp((address,uint256,bytes,by.details: Must validate caller is the entryPoint.      Must validate the signature and nonce

params.missingAccountFunds: - Missing funds on the account's deposit in the entrypoint.                              This is the minimum amount to transfer to the sender(entryPoint) to be                              able to make the call. The excess is left as a deposit in the entrypoint                              for future calls. Can be withdrawn anytime using "entryPoint.withdrawTo()".                              In case there is a paymaster in the request (or the current deposit is high                              enough), this value will be zero.
params.userOp: - The operation that is about to be executed.
params.userOpHash: - Hash of the user's request data. can be used as the basis for signature.

returns.validationData: - Packaged ValidationData structure. use `_packValidationData` and                              `_unpackValidationData` to encode and decode.                              <20-byte> sigAuthorizer - 0 for valid signature, 1 to mark signature failure,                                 otherwise, an address of an "authorizer" contract.                              <6-byte> validUntil - Last timestamp this operation is valid. 0 for "indefinite"                              <6-byte> validAfter - First timestamp this operation is valid                                                    If an account doesn't use time-range, it is enough to                                                    return SIG_VALIDATION_FAILED value (1) for signature failure.                              Note that the validation code cannot use block.timestamp (or block.number) directly.

addGuardian(address).notice: Adds a guardian for social recovery.

addToBlacklist(address).notice: Adds an address to the blacklist.

addToWhitelist(address).notice: Adds an address to the whitelist.

approveERC20(address,address,uint256).notice: Allows the account owner to approve ERC-20 tokens for gasless transactions.

executeBatchWithTransient(address[],uint.notice: Executes multiple operations in a single transaction.

executeWithLimitTransient(address,uint25.notice: Executes a transaction with spending limits enforced. Uses local variables to simulate transient storage for daily checks.

setSecondaryKey(address).notice: Sets a secondary key for MFA.

validateUserOp((address,uint256,bytes,by.notice: Validate user's signature and nonce the entryPoint will make the call to the recipient only if this validation call returns successfully. signature failure should be reported by returning SIG_VALIDATION_FAILED (1). This allows making a "simulation call" without a valid signature Other failures (e.g. nonce mismatch, or invalid signature format) should still revert to signal failure.
